definitions.title: vb. Pi.
definitions.body: betitle, title, give an epithet or cognomen (NH id.; Aram. [[כְּנׇא]], kn0; Ar. kanay)—

definitions.title: Pi.
definitions.body: Impf. 1 s. sf. [[בִשְׁמֶָ ְאֲכַנְּ ְוׇאֶקְרָא לְְ]] Is 45:4 I have called thee by thy name, giving thee a title (of honour; cf. for construction Dr:§ 163); 3 ms. [[וּבְשֵׁם יִשְׂרָאֵל יְכַנֶּה]] Is 44:5, and with the name Israel he titles (himself), is hardly poss.; abs. he betitles, or makes use of a title, is unlikely; rd. prob.

definitions.title: Pu.,
definitions.body: v. infr., in bad sense = give a flattering title: [[וְאֶל־אָדָם לאׁ אֲכַנֶּה]] Job 32:21 and unto man I do not give flattering titles (‖[[אַל־לנׇא אֶשָּׂא פְנֵי אִישׁ]]); abs. v:Job 32:22.

definitions.title: Pu.
definitions.body: Impf. [[יְכֻנֶּה]] Is 44:5 he is betitled (v. supr.; so Targum Bi Che Du; ‖[[יקרא בשׁם יעקב]], etc.)
